an increased transcription rate of a subset of genes of the rpoS regulon in stationary phase

example.text: Cotransfection of GATA-4 with MEF2A, MEF2C or MEF2D leads to a synergistic 40-to 50-fold activation of the ANF promoter (Figure 3A).
example.arg: Cotransfection of GATA-4 with MEF2A, MEF2C or MEF2D
a synergistic 40-to 50-fold activation of the ANF promoter

example.text: In mice, inactivation of the MEF2C gene, which is the first MEF2 isoform expressed during embryonic development, leads to cardiac morphogenetic defects, vascular abnormalities and lethality by embryonic day 9.5 (Lin et al., 1997, 1998; Bi et al., 1999).
example.arg: inactivation of the MEF2C gene
cardiac morphogenetic defects, vascular abnormalities and lethality by embryonic day 9.5

example.text: These data suggest that phosphorylation of the MuSK NPXY site leads to recruitment of a phosphotyrosine-binding domain-containing protein that functions to stimulate phosphorylation and clustering of AchRs.
example.arg: phosphorylation of the MuSK NPXY site
recruitment of a phosphotyrosine-binding domain-containing protein

example.text: This G:C base pair is also the strongest determinant in the sequence selection experiment, which led to the identification of the BRE (Lagrange et al., 1998).
example.arg: the sequence selection experiment
the identification of the BRE

example.text: This, in turn, leads to synergistic activation of the ANF and other MEF2 target promoters independently of the DNA-binding activity of MEF2.
example.arg: This
synergistic activation of the ANF and other MEF2 target promoters

example.text: Closer examination of the putative signal transduction pathway modulating htrA transcription has led us to the identification of two new genes.
example.arg: Closer examination of the putative signal transduction pathway modulating htrA transcription
the identification of two new genes

example.text: Further, experiments with an antisense-ref cDNA expression vector introduced into cultured cells suggested that DNA (nCaRE)-ref1 interaction led to C2+e-mediated transcriptional suppression.
example.arg: DNA (nCaRE)-ref1 interaction
C2+e-mediated transcriptional suppression

example.text: Growth of Escherichia coli in the presence of nitrate or nitrite led to a 45% decrease in expression when cells were cultivated in rich medium.
example.arg: Growth of Escherichia coli in the presence of nitrate or nitrite
a 45% decrease in expression

example.text: It has been shown that Crl stimulates the activity of sigma (S), leading to an increased transcription rate of a subset of genes of the rpoS regulon in stationary phase.
example.arg: Crl stimulates the activity of sigma (S)
an increased transcription rate of a subset of genes of the rpoS regulon in stationary phase

example.text: The loss of TreR function led to derepression of treB encoding an enzymeIITre of the PTS for trehalose and of treC encoding TreC, the cytoplasmic trehalose-6-phosphate hydrolase.
example.arg: The loss of TreR function
derepression of treB

example.text: Transduction of the marA region from a Mar strain, but not a wild-type strain, led to loss of OmpF.
example.arg: Transduction of the marA region from a Mar strain
loss of OmpF

example.text: By direct sequencing of aberrant SSCA conformers were revealed 15 different mutations in a total of 18 unrelated families and 13 single patients. Of these, 10 were novel (7 missense mutations, 2 mutations leading to frameshift, and 1 mutation predicted to affect normal splicing).
example.arg: 7 missense mutations, 2 mutations
frameshift

example.text: Disruption of the SNU246 gene in yeast is lethal and leads to a splicing defect in vivo, indicating that the protein is essential for splicing.
example.arg: Disruption of the SNU246 gene in yeast
a splicing defect in vivo, indicating that the protein is essential for splicing

example.text: G979A affects a splice consensus site at the end of exon 8, and G1488T in exon 14 leads to a replacement of a positive charge in a highly conserved putative transmembrane domain (R496S).
example.arg: G979A affects a splice consensus site at the end of exon 8, and G1488T in exon 14
a replacement of a positive charge in a highly conserved putative transmembrane domain (R496S)

example.text: Genetic deficiency of GM2 activator leads to a neurological disorder, an atypical form of Tay-Sachs disease (GM2 gangliosidosis variant AB).
example.arg: Genetic deficiency of GM2 activator
a neurological disorder

example.text: In this homologous part of the genes, GPB lacks one exon due to a point mutation at the 5 splicing site of the third intron, which inactivates the 5 cleavage event of splicing and leads to ligation of the second to the fourth exon.
example.arg: a point mutation at the 5 splicing site of the third intron
ligation of the second to the fourth exon

example.text: The mutations identified include: two frameshifts and a splice site mutation leading to truncated OA1 proteins; a deletion of a threonine codon at position 290; and four missense mutations, two of which involve amino acids located within putative transmembrane domains.
example.arg: two frameshifts and a splice site mutation
truncated OA1 proteins; a deletion of a threonine codon at position 290; and four missense mutations

example.text: The splice mutation in 5 end of intron 5 leading to abnormal splice in exon 5 and exon 6 appears to be one of the causes of X-linked recessive adrenoleukodystrophy.
example.arg: The splice mutation in 5 end of intron 5
abnormal splice in exon 5 and exon 6

example.text: These results suggest that the distinct amino termini lead to the targeting of individual VDAC isoforms to different cellular compartments.
example.arg: the distinct amino termini
the targeting of individual VDAC isoforms to different cellular compartments

example.text: This leads to a substantial diversity of nebulin and nebulette isoforms.
example.arg: This
a substantial diversity of nebulin and nebulette isoforms

example.text: This patients DNA contains a C----A transversion in the splice acceptor sequence of the last intron of the only ERCC-3 allele that is detectably expressed, leading to a 4 bp insertion in the mRNA and an inactivating frameshift in the C-terminus of the protein.
example.arg: a C----A transversion in the splice acceptor sequence of the last intron of the only ERCC-3 allele
a 4 bp insertion in the mRNA and an inactivating frameshift in the C-terminus of the protein

example.text: This splice mutation in 5 end of intron 5 might lead to abnormal splice in exon 5 and exon 6 and bring about unstable and abnormal ALD protein; the lignoceryl CoA ligase could not transport very long chain fatty acids (VLCFA) into peroxisome and could not function normally; consequently, defective beta-oxidation of VLCFA in peroxisome could result in an accumulation of VLCFAS in the central nervous system, adrenal gland and blood.
example.arg: This splice mutation in 5 end of intron 5
abnormal splice in exon 5 and exon 6

example.text: This was caused by a point mutation (GTC----ATC) at codon 383, which leads to the conservative substitution of isoleucine for valine in the putative fifth extracellular loop of the transporter.
example.arg: a point mutation (GTC----ATC) at codon 383
the conservative substitution of isoleucine for valine in the putative fifth extracellular loop of the transporter

example.text: We also studied in detail a complex splice site mutation, 3332dupl8bp, which was shown to lead to an abnormal JAG1 mRNA, resulting in a premature stop codon.
example.arg: a complex splice site mutation
an abnormal JAG1 mRNA, resulting in a premature stop codon

example.text: By direct sequencing of aberrant SSCA conformers were revealed 15 different mutations in a total of 18 unrelated families and 13 single patients. Of these, 10 were novel (phosphorylation of the MuSK NPXY site that led to recruitment of a phosphotyrosine-binding domain-containing protein, and 1 mutation predicted to affect normal splicing).

example.text: By direct sequencing of aberrant SSCA conformers were revealed 15 different mutations in a total of 18 unrelated families and 13 single patients. a splicing defect in vivo, indicating that the protein is essential for splicing
